entry.title: This thread is not about the soft/hard fork technical debate
entry.summary: The conversation is about the importance of imposing a counterbalancing rule to achieve decentralization or stability. This can be achieved by implementing a "one man one commit" policy, which means that each past commit makes it less likely for the user to get their next commit pulled. The idea is to encourage every Bitcoin user to contribute code to achieve greater decentralization.
